name: Rescate heroico
text:
Rápido. Juega esta carta cuando un Enemigo que no sea [[Élite]] fuese a atacar a otro investigador que esté en tu Lugar.
Enfréntate a ese enemigo y resuelve su ataque contra ti en lugar de contra el otro investigador. A continuación, inflígele 1 punto de daño.
real_text:
Fast. Play when a non-[[Elite]] enemy would attack another investigator at your location.
Engage that enemy and resolve its attack against you instead. Then, deal it 1 damage.

name: Entrenamiento en combate
text:
Rápido. Límite de 1 [[Compostura]] en juego.
El horror que no sea directo debe ser asignado a Entrenamiento en combate antes de que pueda ser asignado a tu carta de Investigador.
[free] Gasta 1 recurso: Recibes +1 [combat] para esta prueba de habilidad.
[free] Gasta 1 recurso: Recibes +1 [agility] para esta prueba de voluntad.
real_text:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
Non-direct horror must be assigned to Combat Training before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.
[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [agility] for this skill test.

name: Diagramas anatómicos
text:
Rápido. Juega esta carta durante el turno de cualquier investigador y sólo si tienes 5 o más puntos de cordura restantes.
Elig eun Enemigo que no sea [[Élite]] y que esté en tu Lugar. Hasta el final del turno del investigador activo, ese Enemigo recibe -2 a combate y -2 a evitar.
real_text:
Fast. Play during any investigator's turn. Play only if you have 5 or more remaining sanity.
Choose a non-[[Elite]] enemy at your location. Until the end of the active investigator's turn, that enemy gets -2 fight and -2 evade.
flavor: Son sólo animales como cualquier otro. O eso pensábamos.

[free] Spend 1 resource: You get +1 [combat] for this skill test.

name: Puño americano
text: [action]: Combatir. Este ataque inflige +1 de daño. El Enemigo atacado obtiene Represalia para este ataque.
real_text: [action]: Fight. This attack deals +1 damage. The attacked enemy gains retaliate for this attack.
traits: Objeto. Arma. Cuerpo a cuerpo. Ilegal.
flavor: Cara a cara y de cerca: justo como le gustaba a Naomi.

name: David Renfield
text:
Mientras David Renfield tenga al menos 1 ficha de Perdición sobre él, recibes +1 [willpower].
[free] Agota a David Renfield: Puedes colocar 1 ficha de Perdición sobre David Renfield. Obtén 1 recurso por cada ficha de Perdición que haya sobre David Renfield.
real_text:
While David Renfield has at least 1 doom on him, you get +1 [willpower].
[fast] Exhaust David Renfield: You may place 1 doom on David Renfield. Gain 1 resource for each doom on David Renfield.

name: Con los pies en la tierra
text:
Rápido. Límite de 1 [[Compostura]] en juego.
El horror que no sea directo debe ser asignado a Con los pies en la tierra antes de que pueda ser asignado a tu carta de Investigador.
[free] Durante una prueba de habilidad de una carta [[Hechizo]], gasta 1 recurso: Recibes +1 a tu valor de habilidad para esta prueba.
real_text:
Fast. Limit 1 [[Composure]] in play.
Non-direct horror must be assigned to Grounded before it can be assigned to your investigator card.
[free] During a skill test on a [[Spell]] card, spend 1 resource: You get +1 skill value for this test.

name: Recuerdo querido
flavor: El Sr. Osito siempre le decía a Wendy que las cosas saldrían bien. Pero claro, el Sr. Osito era un oso de peluche, así que tampoco sabía gran cosa.

text:
Máximo de 1 asignada por prueba de habilidad.
Asigna esta carta a una prueba de habilidad sólo si tienes 3 o menos puntos de cordura restantes.
real_text:
Max 1 committed per skill test.
Commit to a skill test only if you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.

name: Echoes of the Past
text: Easy / Standard [skull]: -X. X is the highest number of doom on an enemy in play. [cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy. [tablet]: -2. If you fail, discard a random card from your hand. [elder_thing]: -2. If you fail and there is an enemy at your location, take 1 horror.
real_text: Easy / Standard [skull]: -X. X is the highest number of doom on an enemy in play. [cultist]: -2. If you fail, place 1 doom on the nearest enemy. [tablet]: -2. If you fail, discard a random card from your hand. [elder_thing]: -2. If you fail and there is an enemy at your location, take 1 horror.
back_text: Hard / Expert [skull]: -X. X is the total number of doom on enemies in play. [cultist]: -4. Place 1 doom on the nearest enemy. [tablet]: -4. Discard a random card from your hand. [elder_thing]: -4. If there is an enemy at your location, take 1 horror.

name: The Truth is Hidden
text: Do not add doom to this agenda during the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
real_text: Do not add doom to this agenda during the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
flavor: Surprisingly, the front doors of the Historical Society’s Georgian manor are cracked halfway open when you arrive. Who else could be here at this hour?
back_text: Shuffle the encounter discard pile into the encounter deck.
back_flavor:
A phrase in a language you cannot describe whispers through the building, and without warning all of the electric lights shatter at once. You light a nearby candle and continue your search.
The building is quite different once plunged into darkness. Shadows and silhouettes dance along the walls. Crevices you hadn't noticed before draw your wary eye. What other secrets does this building hold?

name: Ransacking the Manor
text: Do not add doom to this agenda during the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
real_text: Do not add doom to this agenda during the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
flavor: Though the whispering has ceased, the sounds of rummaging and furniture shifting is unmistakable. Whoever is here, they’re searching just as thoroughly as you are...
back_text:
Spawn the set-aside Possessed Oathspeaker enemy at the Entry Hall.
Check Campaign Log. If Sebastien Moreau is not listed under "VIPs Slain," search the collection for Sebastien Moreau [[(Savage Hysteria)]] and spawn him in the Entry Hall.
back_flavor:
The front door of the manor opens, letting in a howl of chill wind and the pitter-patter of soft rain, then it suddenly slams shut. You find a place to hide and eavesdrop, wondering who else might have entered the building this late. "No, I swear, I swear I don't know where the door is!" A man cries out. "You'll have to find the Path on your own, I cannot help you!" He sounds panicked and disorientated.
"You spoke the Oath," a man's voice responds. "You spoke His name." The man stammers. "No! No, I cannot! I will not!" Then, his voice becomes distorted, and he speaks no more. You hear footsteps on the staircase - heavy and wet.

name: Secrets Better Left Hidden
text: Do not add doom to this agenda during the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
real_text: Do not add doom to this agenda during the Mythos phase. Forced - After 1 or more clues are placed on an enemy in play: Flip those clues to their doom side.
flavor: Whoever these people are, they must be involved with the conspiracy behind [[The King in Yellow]]. You can’t let them find whatever it is they’re looking for!
back_flavor:
There is a rush of footsteps along the manor's central stairway, and the front door opens once more. "Have you found it?" A muffled voice asks.
"Ye. We can embark immediately. The Path [[will]] be opened."
The door closes, and the manor returns to being quiet and lonely. For the remainder of your search, you find no further traces of the mysterious robed figures, nor do you find any information to answer your many questions about [[The King in Yellow]]...

name: Race for Answers
flavor: Each of the Historical Society’s many rooms contains records and documents that may aid you in your search for answers about [[The King in Yellow]]. There must be something here that can guide you toward the truth.
back_text: For each revealed Historical Society location, add 1 [per_investigator] clues to it (to a maximum of its clue value).
back_flavor:
You find a record kept by one of the society's historians pertaining to the "dreadful events" surrounding the closing of an old theatre in Arkham, the Cedar Playhouse. Though there is no explicit mention of [[The King in Yellow]], you believe you are on the right track.
The historian's notes are cut short, and there is a faded, handwritten page clipped to the final entry.
<b>This matter is too ghastly for the public eye. I am placing the remainder of this record in the hidden library. All further inquiries should be done away from prying eyes, for this is a dangerous matter, and not one to be researched lightly.

name: Mistakes of the Past
flavor: Somewhere in the manor is a "hidden library" where you might be able to find more information about [[The King in Yellow]]. You must find the way in if you are to continue your investigation.
back_text:
For each revealed Historical Society location, add 1 [per_investigator] clues to it (to a maximum of its clue value).
Choose an investigator to take control of the set-aside Mr. Peabody asset.
Put the set-aside Hidden Library location into play.
back_flavor:
As you rummage through a desk drawer, you are startled when you hear a voice behind you. "Excuse me! Can I help you?" You are relived to find the voice belonging to a thin, elderly man wearing wide-rimmed glasses - a member of the Historical Society, no doubt. You explain to him that you are searching for a hidden library somewhere in the manor, though you purposely leave out why.
He introduces himself as Mr. Peabody, the Historical Society's curator. "I'll help you find what you are looking for," he explains, "but only if you tell me what this is all about once we get there." You hope it doesn't come to that.

name: The Oath
text: Locations with the [[Passageway]] trait are connected to one another. Objective - Only investigators in the Hidden Library may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
real_text: Locations with the [[Passageway]] trait are connected to one another. Objective - Only investigators in the Hidden Library may spend the requisite number of clues, as a group, to advance.
flavor: "This building is very old, and filled with all manner of secret passageways," Mr. Peabody explains. "Perhaps one of them will lead to this library you’re looking for."
back_text: The investigators must decide (choose one): - This is an important discovery! We should take it with us. (→R1). - It's just a silly trinket, and it would be wrong to steal from the Historical Society. Leave it behind. (→R2)
back_flavor: As you study the hidden library, you find a few pieces of information that stand out. As with the recent production, the previous performance of [[The King in Yellow]] came to Arkham from overseas, and was performed by a French acting troupe. You don't recognize any of the cast members' names, and of course the actor who played the role of the Stranger is anonymous. However, it seems that a member of the Historical Society has done some of your work for you; there are several old newspaper clippings gathered together along with information about the play. Headlines include: Cedar Playhouse Closes Due To Fire, Experts Baffled Over Freak Floods, and the like. Hidden amongst this information, you also find a strange object - A clasp of onyx with an alien inscription.

name: Entry Hall
text: Entry Hall is connected to each other [[Ground Floor]] location. [action]: Resign. You flee, leaving the mysteries of the past to the mysterious cultists.
real_text: Entry Hall is connected to each other [[Ground Floor]] location. [action]: Resign. You flee, leaving the mysteries of the past to the mysterious cultists.
back_text: Entry Hall is connected to each other [[Ground Floor]] location.
back_flavor: A long, warm hall and two grand staircases greet you as you enter the manor house of Arkham’s Historical Society.

name: Historical Society
text: [action] Exhaust an [[Ally]] asset: Discover a clue at this location. (Limit once per round.)
real_text: [action] Exhaust an [[Ally]] asset: Discover a clue at this location. (Limit once per round.)
flavor: One of the chairs is knocked over, and a hole is torn in the ceiling above. What could possibly have created such damage?
back_text: Forced - When an enemy spawns at this location: Reveal this location.
back_flavor: An unadorned wooden door leads to one of the ground floor rooms used by the Historical Society.

name: Historical Society
text: Each enemy at this location gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
real_text: Each enemy at this location gets +1 fight and +1 evade.
flavor: This confined room contains numerous files that might have been helpful to your investigation were it not for the thick, awful sludge filling the file cabinet drawers.
back_text: Forced - When an enemy spawns at this location: Reveal this location.
back_flavor: An unadorned wooden door leads to one of the ground floor rooms used by the Historical Society.

name: Historical Society
text: While investigating this location, your [intellect] cannot be modified.
real_text: While investigating this location, your [intellect] cannot be modified.
flavor: Most of the objects on display here are from the early 18th century, spanning Arkham's colonization and early history.
back_text: Forced - When an enemy spawns at this location: Reveal this location.
back_flavor: An unadorned wooden door leads to one of the ground floor rooms used by the Historical Society.

name: Quiet Halls
text:
Quiet Halls is connected to each other [[Second Floor]] location.
[action] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Quiet Halls [[(from the token bank)]].
real_text: Quiet Halls is connected to each other [[Second Floor]] location. [action] If each location in play is revealed and there are no clues on locations in play: Place 1 [per_investigator] clues on Quiet Halls (from the token bank).
back_text: Quiet Halls is connected to each other [[Second Floor]] location.
back_flavor: Other than the creaking of the wooden floor beneath your steps, the manor is eerily silent.

name: Historical Society
text: While investigating this location, your [intellect] cannot be modified.
real_text: While investigating this location, your [intellect] cannot be modified.
flavor: Most of the objects on display here are from the early 18th century, spanning Arkham's colonization and early history.
back_text: Forced - When an enemy spawns at this location: Reveal this location.
back_flavor: An unadorned wooden door leads to one of the second floor rooms used by the Historical Society.

name: Historical Society
text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate this location, take 2 horror: Discover 1 clue at this location. (Limit once per round).
real_text: [reaction] After you successfully investigate this location, take 2 horror: Discover 1 clue at this location. (Limit once per round).
flavor: The sheer number of books in the Historical Society's library is overwhelming. Even if you had weeks to spend researching, you couldn't hope to sort through all of them.
back_text: Forced - When an enemy spawns at this location: Reveal this location.
back_flavor: An unadorned wooden door leads to one of the second floor rooms used by the Historical Society.

name: Historical Society
text: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, choose an enemy with doom on it. Take 1 of that enemy's doom, flip it to its clue side, and place it on your investigator. (Group limit once per round).
real_text: [action]: Investigate. If you succeed, instead of discovering clues, choose an enemy with doom on it. Take 1 of that enemy's doom, flip it to its clue side, and place it on your investigator. (Group limit once per round).
flavor: From the flickering lamplight and open books, you can tell that someone was reading in here recently.
back_text: Forced - When an enemy spawns at this location: Reveal this location.
back_flavor: An unadorned wooden door leads to one of the second floor rooms used by the Historical Society.

text: While an investigator at this location controls Mr. Peabody, this location gets -2 shroud.

flavor: This office must belong to somebody important within the Historical Society.

name: Hidden Library
text: While an enemy is moving, Hidden Library gains the [[Passageway]] trait.
real_text: While an enemy is moving, Hidden Library gains the [[Passageway]] trait.
flavor:
The space was a small reading room, carpeted with cobwebs and dust. Filled bookshelves lined the walls, but a few books lay scattered on the floor as though their readers had abandoned them in a hurry.
- Lisa Farrell, [[The Investigators of Arkham Horror]]
back_text: While an enemy is moving, Hidden Library gains the [[Passageway]] trait.
back_flavor: Most of the researchers in the Historical Society don’t even know of this library’s existence. What terrible truths could it be hiding?

name: Juramentado poseído
text: Cazador. Represalia. No puede ser dañado durante los actos 1 y 2. Obligado - Al comienzo de la fase de Enemigos: Los investigadores deben preparar al Juramentado poseído o bien colocar 1 ficha de Perdición sobre él. Objetivo - Si el Juramentado poseído es derrotado: (→R3)
real_text: Hunter. Retaliate. Cannot be damaged during act 1 or act 2. Forced - At the beginning of the enemy phase: The investigators must either ready Possessed Oathspeaker or place 1 doom on it. Objective - If Possessed Oathspeaker is defeated: (→R3)

name: Sr. Peabody
text: [action] Agota al Sr. Peabody: Elige un Lugar. Hasta que el Sr. Peabody se prepare, ese Lugar recibe -1 a velo y obtiene el rasgo [[Pasadizo]].
real_text: [action] Exhaust Mr. Peabody: Choose a location. Until Mr. Peabody readies, that location gets -1 shroud and gains the [[Passageway]] trait.
flavor: "Este edificio contiene muchos secretos. Le enseñaré algunos, pero ni siquiera yo los conozcos todos…"

name: Broche de ónice negro
text: Mientras el Broche de ónice negro esté en tu mano, aumenta en 1 el coste de todas las demás cartas de tu mano.
real_text: While Clasp of Black Onyx is in your hand, increase the cost of each other card in your hand by 1.
flavor: No era árabe ni chino, ni tampoco pertenecía a ningún tipo de escritura humana, como más tarde averigüé. – Robert W. Chambers, "El Signo Amarillo," [[El Rey de Amarillo]]

name: El Manto Andrajoso
text:
Recibes -1 de cordura.
Recibes +1 [willpower], +1 [combat] y +1 [agility] mientras tengas 3 o menos puntos de cordura restantes.
real_text:
You get -1 sanity.
You get +1 [willpower], +1 [combat], and +1 [agility] while you have 3 or fewer remaining sanity.

name: Seeker of Carcosa
text: Spawn - Any empty Historical Society location. Aloof. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Move 1 clue from Seeker of Carcosa's location to Seeker of Carcosa (if you cannot, place 1 doom on Seeker of Carcosa, instead).
real_text: Spawn - Any empty Historical Society location. Aloof. Forced - At the end of the mythos phase: Move 1 clue from Seeker of Carcosa's location to Seeker of Carcosa (if you cannot, place 1 doom on Seeker of Carcosa, instead).

name: Led Astray
text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 of your clues on a [[Cultist]] enemy. - Place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance).
real_text: Peril. Revelation - You must decide (choose one): - Place 1 of your clues on a [[Cultist]] enemy. - Place 1 doom on the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance).

name: The Cult's Search
text: Revelation - If there is a [[Cultist]] enemy in play with doom on it, move all doom from each [[Cultist]] enemy to the current agenda (this effect may cause the current agenda to advance). If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play with doom on them, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it (shuffle the encounter deck).

If there are no [[Cultist]] enemies in play with doom on them, search the encounter deck and discard pile for a [[Cultist]] enemy and draw it (shuffle the encounter deck).
